channel.title: Parth Parikh's Blog
channel.description: Explore the exciting world of Computer Science with me! From the depths of Data Structures and Algorithms to the cutting-edge advancements in NLP and Databases, my blog delves into a wide range of topics to keep you informed and inspired.

item.title: Timing Wheels
item.description: In this blog-post, we will start by discussing the evolution of timekeeping, leading all the way to its use in computers. We will then introduce software timer modules, and explain timing wheels as a fast and memory efficient way to manage timers. Finally, we will discuss both the classic Linux timer wheel implementation and its modern variant.

item.title: What if companies were governed as republics?
item.description: In this blog post, we will explore a whitepaper for technology startups, describing a 'mini-republic' corporate charter inspired by some historical constitutional documents and the Roman Republic.

item.title: An Afternoon with SMT, TRIM, and SMART
item.description: In this blog post, we will be diving into the world of SSDs, covering SMT, TRIM, and SMART, plus I'll be geeking out over my MacBook upgrade.

item.title: Tinker Postman Collector Scribe
item.description: In this blog post, we will explore art, USPS postal technology, philately, and generative art â€” all inspired by my trip to D.C. last month.

item.title: We'll buy back your Typewriter ... for Uncle Sam!
item.description: In this blog post, we will explore another poster I recently bought, which highlights Smith-Corona's campaign to buy back typewriters for the U.S. government due to wartime shortages during World War II.
